author: Zui Chen
title: Unmasking Masks
subtitle: Uncovering global attitudes towards masks.
description: Uncovering global attitudes towards masks. Masks have recently become common objects in our daily life and triggered a world-wide dissonance due to COVID-19. And there is a clear difference in attitudes between East Asian countries and the Western world.

author: Amanda Anderson-You
title: Climate & Sleep
subtitle: Exploring the relationship between the climate crisis and sleep health
description: Exploring the relationship between the climate crisis and sleep health

author: Antonie Dreyer
title: From NACA to NASA
subtitle: Visualizing research paper metadata in the field of Aerospace Engineering
description: Visualizing research paper metadata in the field of Aerospace Engineering for more efficient knowledge exploration, research and learning. The project combines a flattened hierarchical “front-of-the book” table of contents structure with a network-based “back-of-the book” index connectivity over time.

author: Brad MacDonald
title: The Rona and Me
subtitle: An emoji-focused reflection on my experience with COVID-19.
description: An emoji-focused reflection on my experience with COVID-19 in an era of imposed digital connection.

author: Caitlyn Ralph
title: Gut vs. Data
subtitle: Mapping touring histories to British indie and alternative career arcs.
description: The aim of this thesis is to map touring histories to British indie and alternative career arcs in a post-streaming world, ultimately creating and visualizing an artist’s career fingerprint through live music.

author: Dan Grunebaum
title: Turning Japanese
subtitle: The Globalization of Japanese Language and Concepts.
description: The Globalization of Japanese Language and Concepts

author: Dan Ran
title: Shenzhen
subtitle: Shenzhen, known as China’s booming silicon valley today, used to be a small fish town 40 years ago.
description: Shenzhen, known as China’s booming silicon valley today, used to be a small fish town 40 “year”s ago. Today, it ranks one of the top mega-cities in China and leading examples of urbanization in developing countries.

author: Janice Yamanaka-Lew
title: Swamp Walk
subtitle: Stepping into the Great Swamp Swamps have always been a source of terror and fascination but are actually valuable ecosystems.
description: Stepping into the Great Swamp Swamps have always been a source of terror and fascination but are actually valuable ecosystems. Swamp Walk weaves together the cultural prejudices and the ecological value of swamps, along with archival graphics from the jetport battle that took place in The Great Swamp in New Jersey between 1959 to 1970.

author: John Outwater
title: Sensing Blue
subtitle: Modern blueberry breeding.
description: The role of flavor perception in modern blueberry breeding

author: Lulu Tanenbaum
title: Your Brain on Political Media
subtitle: Voting choices are made on more than just facts...
description: Voting choices are made on more than just facts – emotion, bias and unconscious thought play an important role in one’s decision-making process. But what effect does advertising have? This thesis visualizes American voters’ unconscious response to political advertising & media.

author: Marisa Ruiz Asari
title: Weapons of Mass Injustice
subtitle: Visualizing the unequal impacts of gun violence.
description: Visualizing the unequal impacts of gun violence and the search for peace in America’s cities.

author: Michael Desai
title: Visual Value
subtitle: 2019 Income Statements
description: A User Interface for Exploring Income Statements

author: Mio Akasako
title: Women in STEM
subtitle: Exploring different facets of sexual misconduct, harassment, and discrimination in STEM academia...
description: Exploring different facets of sexual misconduct, harassment, and discrimination in STEM academia to highlight how the environment has protected perpetrators of sexual misconduct, and facilitated a self-perpetuating gender gap to this day.

author: Neil Oliver
title: Is Twitter Feeding Bitcoin?
subtitle: An analysis of Twitter content.
description: An analysis of Twitter content, user behavior, and correlation to Bitcoin market value.

author: Nour Zein
title: Greening From the Rooftops
subtitle: New York City‘s Green Roof Potential.
description: A User Interface for Mapping New York City‘s Green Roof Potential

author: Robin Coenen
title: With Compliments to the Secretary General
subtitle: Visualizing Maritime Claims at the UN.
description: Visualizing Maritime Claims at the UN in regard to the Continental Shelf.

author: Saloni Naishad Shah
title: Are Forest Money or Mitigation?
subtitle: Carbon cap and trade markets on deforestation and emissions.
description: Understanding the impact of carbon cap and trade markets on deforestation and emissions.

author: Xingwei Huang
title: A Guilty Pleasure
subtitle: Cocoa Production is Driving Deforestation.
description: How Cocoa Production is Driving Deforestation in The Ivory Coast

author: Yiran Ni
title: Global Travel of Zoonotic Diseases
subtitle: how global wildlife trading is related to the zoonotic diseases.
description: An analysis of how global wildlife trading is related to the zoonotic diseases.
